content:
Diagnosis:
Invasive mucinous carcinoma of left breast, pT1cN0M0
Diagnosed March 2023
Grade 1, ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative, Ki67 10%
No lymphovascular invasion

Treatment:
Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy 15 April 2023
Adjuvant radiotherapy completed June 2023
Continuing adjuvant endocrine therapy - Letrozole 2.5mg daily

Current situation:
Routine follow-up at 12 months post-diagnosis

I reviewed [redacted name] in the breast oncology follow-up clinic today. She continues to tolerate Letrozole well with only mild joint stiffness in the mornings which improves with regular exercise. She has maintained good compliance with her medication and understands the importance of completing 5 years of endocrine therapy. Her energy levels have improved significantly since completing radiotherapy, and she has returned to her regular swimming activities three times per week.

On examination today, the left breast shows excellent cosmetic outcome with well-healed surgical scar. There is no lymphadenopathy and no clinical evidence of recurrence. Recent mammogram in February 2024 showed post-treatment changes only with no suspicious features.

The plan is to continue with current endocrine therapy and arrange routine follow-up mammogram in 12 months. We will review her again in the breast clinic in 6 months. She understands to contact the breast care nurses if she develops any new concerns in the interim.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Grade 1 invasive mucinous carcinoma, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Mammogram shows post-treatment changes only with no suspicious features

patient_facts.value: Mild joint stiffness in the mornings improving with exercise
Maintains regular swimming activities three times per week
Left breast shows excellent cosmetic outcome with well-healed surgical scar, no lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Early stage breast cancer post surgery and radiotherapy. Good tolerance of ongoing adjuvant endocrine therapy with no evidence of recurrence
Continuing Letrozole 2.5mg daily with good compliance
Review in breast clinic in 6 months
